poem:
**Storm Bert**

The critics find their voices  
rising like floodwaters in Wales,  
as weather—or the warnings—  
lapped quietly at doorsteps.  
Our shoes soaked now in hindsight,  
umbrellas open to take slight shelter  
from this storm of blame,  
our words a deluge of could-have-beens,  
every forecast delivered  
with the clarity of hindsight.
